story_title: Lincoln's Secret Life as a Wrestling Champion
original_story: [excited] You won't believe Abraham Lincoln was a wrestling champ! Before his presidency, this 6'4” giant dominated the rings in Illinois. In 1830, he had a match against the notorious Jack Armstrong, earning the title of local hero. Known for his strength and agility, Lincoln won nearly every match, boasting a record of over 300 victories! His wrestling skills even helped shape his political prowess, as he learned to handle tough opponents. Who knew this future president was once a fierce grappler? Wild, right?

The crowd roars in excitement, with dramatic chiaroscuro lighting highlighting their determined expressions and the dust swirling around them, capturing the intensity of the match.
